sections.title: Major Milestone: GC Secure Artifacts Platform Launch
sections.content: Shared Services Canada is pleased to announce the successful launch of GC Secure Artifacts, now operational for unclassified workloads across all federal departments and agencies. This initiative represents a significant advancement in the Government of Canada's digital transformation and cybersecurity strategy.

highlight_box.title: Strategic Platform Benefits
items: Centralized Security Management: Unified artifact repository with enterprise-grade security controls
Zero-Vulnerability Container Images: Chainguard's security-first approach to base images
Cost Optimization: Shared infrastructure reducing departmental procurement overhead
Compliance Framework: Built-in audit trails and security scanning capabilities
Supply Chain Protection: End-to-end visibility and vulnerability management

subsections.title: JFrog Enterprise+ Platform
subsections.content: The Government of Canada has successfully procured and deployed the JFrog Platform (Enterprise Plus), providing comprehensive DevSecOps capabilities:

feature_cards.title: Universal Artifact Repository
feature_cards.content: Centralized storage and management for Docker containers, Maven artifacts, NPM packages, NuGet packages, Helm charts, and additional package formats.

feature_cards.title: Advanced Security Scanning
feature_cards.content: Integrated JFrog Xray vulnerability detection with automated policy enforcement and continuous security monitoring.

feature_cards.title: Enterprise Access Controls
feature_cards.content: Role-based permissions, repository segmentation, and fine-grained access management aligned with government security requirements.

feature_cards.title: Compliance and Audit
feature_cards.content: Complete audit trails, build information tracking, and compliance reporting capabilities for regulatory requirements.

subsections.title: Chainguard Secure Container Images
subsections.content: Our strategic partnership with Chainguard delivers the industry's most secure container base images:

feature_cards.title: Zero-CVE Architecture
feature_cards.content: No known security vulnerabilities in our curated container image collection, providing a secure foundation for application development.

feature_cards.title: Distroless Implementation
feature_cards.content: Minimal attack surface achieved by including only essential runtime components, reducing potential security exposure.

feature_cards.title: Cryptographic Signatures
feature_cards.content: All images are cryptographically signed with comprehensive Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) for supply chain transparency.

feature_cards.title: Continuous Updates
feature_cards.content: Automated security patches and updates ensure images remain current with the latest security improvements.

sections.title: Implementation and Onboarding
sections.content: Federal departments and agencies can begin leveraging GC Secure Artifacts through the following structured process:

phases.title: Phase 1: Access Request and Authentication
phases.content: Submit access request through the official Government of Canada onboarding form and configure Single Sign-On (SSO) authentication through the 163ENT Entra ID tenant.

phases.title: Phase 2: Development Environment Integration
phases.content: Update existing Dockerfiles to reference secure Chainguard base images and integrate JFrog CLI tools into continuous integration pipelines.

phases.title: Phase 3: Security Configuration
phases.content: Implement automated dependency scanning, container vulnerability assessment, and policy-based security controls within development workflows.

phases.title: Phase 4: Production Deployment
phases.content: Deploy applications using verified artifacts with continuous monitoring, automated compliance reporting, and incident response procedures.

sections.title: Training and Support Resources
sections.content: Comprehensive training and support resources are available to ensure successful platform adoption:
list_items: JFrog Academy Training: Self-paced and instructor-led courses for administrators, developers, and DevSecOps teams
Technical Documentation: Complete implementation guides, API references, and best practices documentation
Configuration as Code: Standardized templates and automation scripts for rapid deployment
Support Services: Dedicated technical support and escalation procedures for operational issues

sections.title: Étape Importante : Lancement de la Plateforme d'Artefacts Sécurisés GC
sections.content: Services partagés Canada est heureux d'annoncer le lancement réussi des Artefacts Sécurisés GC, maintenant opérationnels pour les charges de travail non classifiées dans tous les ministères et organismes fédéraux. Cette initiative représente une avancée significative dans la transformation numérique et la stratégie de cybersécurité du Gouvernement du Canada.

highlight_box.title: Avantages Stratégiques de la Plateforme
items: Gestion Centralisée de la Sécurité : Référentiel d'artefacts unifié avec contrôles de sécurité de niveau entreprise
Images de Conteneurs Sans Vulnérabilité : Approche sécuritaire de Chainguard pour les images de base
Optimisation des Coûts : Infrastructure partagée réduisant les coûts d'approvisionnement ministériels
Cadre de Conformité : Pistes d'audit intégrées et capacités d'analyse de sécurité
Protection de la Chaîne d'Approvisionnement : Visibilité de bout en bout et gestion des vulnérabilités
